here alright so in its simplest form all
a brine is is a water solution that has
a good amount of salt and sugar in it
all right nothing more complicated than
that brining is not a gimmick it's not a
fad it is a brilliant brilliant step to
get super juicy meat especially pork
that you're going to grill which could

this went about 6 hours all righty so 6

I'm going to dry those off with paper

hope you saw that video so I went out to
the grill I had a nice hot charcoal fire
my strategy with these thick pork chops
rind or not brined is to mark them over
the hot part of the fire to get those
nice perfect grill marks so basically
I'll do that on both sides and then I'll
move them off away from the hottest part
of the fire so for me the hottest part
of my fire here was in that back right
corner so basically I just moved my pork
chops off away from that area and
towards the end of the cooking of course
I brushed them with my Carolina style
barbecue sauce it was a delicious Apple
mustard concoction
so regardless of your cooking method or
how you like to cook your pork chops
whether it's on the grill or in the oven
or under the broiler whatever this brine
is fantastic because what it does is it
allows the meat to retain more moisture
and who you're going to believe me or
